entries.title: Oracle Hires Chief Legal Officer From Facebook's Blockchain Project
entries.description: Stuart Levey most recently served as the CEO of Meta Platform’s cryptocurrency project, which sold its assets earlier this year.

entries.title: Silicon Valley Poured Money Into FTX, With Few Strings Attached
entries.description: Investors from Silicon Valley and Wall Street promoted the crypto exchange as a safe bet and invested nearly $2 billion with no oversight on its board.

entries.title: It's the New Saying Among Tech CEOs: I Apologize
entries.description: Facebook, Twitter and other firms are slashing jobs, and their leaders’ mea culpas are abundant.

entries.title: Elon Musk Tells Twitter Employees Remote Work Is Over
entries.description: The billionaire owner says the economic picture is dire; ‘The road ahead is arduous and will require intense work to succeed’

entries.title: New Technology Lets Farmers Use Land for Both Solar Panels and Crops
entries.description: By using elevated panels, researchers hope they can generate electricity without reducing yields on the crops growing underneath.

entries.title: Amazon Has Launched a Cost-Cutting Review Focused on Unprofitable Business Units
entries.description: CEO Andy Jassy is leading the review including the devices unit, which includes Alexa and has had an annual operating loss of $5 billion in some recent years, documents show.

entries.title: FTX Tapped Into Customer Accounts to Fund Risky Bets
entries.description: Crypto exchange FTX lent billions of dollars worth of customer assets to fund bets by its affiliated trading firm, Alameda Research, setting the stage for the exchange’s implosion, a person familiar with the matter said.

entries.title: How Many People Are Watching 'Thursday Night Football'? That Is Up for Debate
entries.description: Analyzing ratings for Amazon Prime Video’s ‘Thursday Night Football’ has become as complicated as some National Football League rules.

entries.title: How Twitch CEO Emmett Shear Gets to Inbox Zero
entries.description: The 39-year-old head of the gaming and entertainment live-streaming service shares what’s on his phone.

entries.title: Apple Supply Crunch on Premium iPhone Threatens to Derail Record Sales Run
entries.description: Apple’s warning this week about iPhone supply limitations threatens one of biggest drivers of the company’s record-breaking sales in recent years: persuading customers to buy its priciest smartphones.

entries.title: Layoffs Aren't a Good Look for Big Tech's Growth Story
entries.description: Meta Platforms, Twitter and other tech companies have shown they are economically sensitive, puncturing the myth of “permanent acceleration.”

entries.title: Foxconn Says Aims to Swiftly Recover iPhone Production Levels at Covid-Hit Site
entries.description: Foxconn is still operating its main iPhone plant in Zhengzhou under a closed-loop system.

entries.title: Twitter's Moderation Boss Is an Unlikely Ally of Elon Musk
entries.description: Yoel Roth, who has been accused of being anticonservative, polices the site’s content.

entries.title: Paul Allen's Art Collection Sets Record With $1.5 Billion Sale
entries.description: The auction at Christie’s offered a trove of trophies from artists like Cézanne, Seurat and Botticelli.

entries.title: Rivian's Losses Mount as It Continues to Burn Through Cash
entries.description: The electric-vehicle startup said it lost $1.74 billion in the third quarter as it continued to struggle with higher material costs and underused assembly lines.
